dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, I was just reading that, um, everything's actually chill with social media and kids these days. Nothing to worry about.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, I was just reading that, um, everything's actually chill with social media and kids these days. Nothing to worry about.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Member of the Mazhilis Zhanarbek Ashimzhanov has called for stronger measures against the LGBT movement in Kazakhstan. According to the deputy, recent years have seen an increase in the activity of organizations on social media that, in his view, promote values contrary to national traditions, including LGBT-related content.

dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? No! No, no, no. Have you seen what's happening in, uh, Kazakhstan? This MP, Zhanarbek Ashimzhanov, is saying like, the complete opposite.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, yeah, I saw something about that! He thinks, um, social media is, like, promoting values contrary to their national traditions?

dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! He's calling it a "negative shift," right? And, uh, he's even bringing up these old predictions from their ancestors!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! He's calling it a negative shift, right? And, uh, he's even bringing up these old predictions from their ancestors!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He referred to this trend as a negative shift. "The predictions of our ancestors, Manke Bi and Mashkhur Zhusup, are coming true - our future generations may change for the worse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ancestors! Like, wow. And didn't he mention President Tokayev too? About "democratic moral values" being, like, imposed by international NGOs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ancestors! Like, wow. And didn't he mention President Tokayev too? About democratic moral values being, like, imposed by international NGOs?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the National Kurultai in Borovoye, President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev clearly stated: 'For decades, so-called democratic moral values, including LGBT, were imposed on many countries by international NGOs and organizations. Under this banner, they interfered in the internal affairs of many nations,'" Ashimzhanov said while reading his official inquiry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! He's saying they're, um, interfering. Pushing these "alien values" that could totally, you know, weaken Kazakh society.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! He's saying they're, um, interfering. Pushing these alien values that could totally, you know, weaken Kazakh society.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deputy believes that promoting what he described as 'alien values' could weaken Kazakh society.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the TikTok thing! He specifically called out TikTok for, like, pushing young people towards "immoral behavior," right? Because kids are, uh, immature.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the TikTok thing! He specifically called out TikTok for, like, pushing young people towards immoral behavior, right? Because kids are, uh, immature.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "They use TikTok and other platforms to push young people toward immoral behavior. Obviously, children and teenagers cannot yet distinguish between right and wrong. They are psychologically immature and morally vulnerable...

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, completely! Psychologically immature, morally vulnerable, easy targets, he said, for "insidious propaganda."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, completely! Psychologically immature, morally vulnerable, easy targets, he said, for insidious propaganda.

dialogue_turns.text: Insidious propaganda! Yeah, that's intense. And he thinks it's violating children's rights too, like the UN Convention.

dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And he even, um, he thinks it's all funded from abroad, like, these foreign-funded NGOs messing with things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And he even, um, he thinks it's all funded from abroad, like, these foreign-funded NGOs messing with things.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ashimzhanov also claimed that such activities are funded from abroad. "They interfere in the internal affairs of our country and promote ideas foreign to our national identity by granting funds to NGOs working in this field.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's right! He mentioned "Feminita," didn't he? Like, sending messages in school chats?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's right! He mentioned Feminita, didn't he? Like, sending messages in school chats?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, an organization called 'Feminita' was allegedly sending messages in school chats, inviting children to events where they promised to talk about sex and 'teach them to be homosexual or lesbian,'" he stated.

dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Inviting kids to events, and, uh, get this, promising to teach them to be, like, homosexual or lesbian.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow. So he wants, like, stricter regulation then? Social media, that sort of thing?

dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely! Stricter regulation, a study on the impact of LGBT content, and, um, a ban on foreign-funded NGOs working with children.

dialogue_turns.text: A ban! Wow. So it's not just him, though, right? Another MP, Rinat Zaitov, also called these communities a "threat."
